column4: Can someone help me with my laptop that wont shutdown when I click shutdown?
if you run:  sudo shutdown -h now    does it die?
yes, that is my temp fix :P
I want it to just shutdown using the gui buttons. Instead it logs me out
just checking, its good to test
I think it is a rights issue
but even when logged out, the menu there will not shutdown the machine either
try: gksudo gedit /etc/init.d/halt   and add: rmmod snd-hda-intel
add it below the line: ### END INIT INFO
This did not work. It also seemes to have reset unity or something as my bar on the left is now back to default
I'm having multiple issues anyway; I also have to fill in my password everywhere I need to twice, always. The first time is ignored even if I use a wrong pwd
editing that file will not change unity in any way
I did not expect it to, perhaps it was me shutting down the laptop with the pwr button. In any case, it did not solde the problem
how fast is your web connection? Are you installing to an SSD? How fast is your cpu?
It sure is nice and minimal. But I'm not quite ready yet
as long as LAN works then install the desktop with apt-get. Its groovy
I'm doing that, but it is a nearly endless list of packages (835). I can't figure out the order, so for now I suppose I must be patient
